definition: "ice" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 15), occurring in 冰[bing1], 次[ci4] etc, known as 兩點水|两点水[liang3 dian3 shui3]
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)
a neglected branch (of arts, science, sports etc)/fig. a complete unknown who wins a competition
cold war/(fig.) strained relationship/to be barely on speaking terms
cold war/(fig.) strained relationship/to be barely on speaking terms
cold war/(fig.) strained relationship/to be barely on speaking terms
cold and detached towards sb/lack of regard/indifference/neglect

sentences.english: Its always warm in spring, hot in summer and cold in winter.
sentences.chinese: 它總是溫暖的春天，夏熱冬冷。

sentences.english: Since it is very cold at the top, coverall is required.
sentences.chinese: 由於山頂很冷，連身服裝是必須的。

sentences.english: I have chills and a headache.
A fresh meat store recently opened in the food market.
sentences.chinese: 菜場新開了一家專賣冷鮮肉的店鋪。

sentences.english: He turned the heat up because it was very cold inside the house.
sentences.chinese: 他把暖氣開大了點，因爲屋裏非常冷。

sentences.english: I feel pain here whenever I drink something cold .
sentences.chinese: 我只要一喝冷的東西就覺得這裏痛。

sentences.english: You ought to know better than to go out without an overcoat on such a cold day.
sentences.chinese: 你應當懂得這樣冷的天不穿大衣出去可不行。

sentences.english: Alina was tired, and cold, and sad.
The research indicates that chilled water thermal storage system has remarkable economic efficiency and social efficiency.
sentences.chinese: 研究表明水蓄冷空調具有顯著的經濟效益和社會效益。

sentences.english: The sponge in the cushion and the backrest are both manufactured by employing freeze foaming and forming techniques.
sentences.chinese: 座墊和靠背海綿均採用冷固化發泡成型技術製造。

sentences.english: Thing is, headphones don’t offer much warmth and getting cold ears isn’t fun.
sentences.chinese: 問題是，耳機不能保暖，耳朵越來越冷這就不好玩了。

sentences.english: Especial chilly in the later fall night.
Roger went across to the bed and put his hand on her arm.It was cold.
sentences.chinese: 羅傑走到牀前把手放在她的手臂上，屍體已經冷了。

sentences.english: Idling for long periods in cold weather can actually cause excessive engine wear.
sentences.chinese: 冷天時的長時間怠速會造成發動機過分磨損。

sentences.english: It was so cold that we were all shivering.
sentences.chinese: 天氣冷極了，我們全部打着哆嗦。

sentences.english: If the nights are cold, the days are hot.

definition: chilled to the bone/(of the wind) chilly

the five Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Liang 前涼|前凉 (314-376), Later Liang 後涼|后凉 (386-403), Northern Liang 北涼|北凉 (398-439), Southern Liang 南涼|南凉 (397-414), Western Liang 西涼|西凉 (400-421)
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
cold weather, frozen ground (idiom); bitterly cold
